boat.name: Equinox
boat.full_description:
Exhibited as a part build at the 1999 Southampton Boatshow, Equinox returned to Cornish Crabbers in Rock after the show to complete her fitting out. She was launched in Chichester in Feb 2000. Over the years she has sailed extensively in the West Country, the Scillies and Bristol Channel before completing a solo circumnavigation of Great Britain, Ireland and the Hebrides in 2010. Taking 3 months 9 days and covering 2,757 miles, the voyage raised over £10,000 for Prostate Cancer Charity. A diary of the voyage can be found here.

In 2013, Equinox took part in the OGA Round Britain Challenge, sailing from the Hamble to Plymouth and back. The skipper's somewhat eventful passages reported in three instalments on Sailing by.

On 1 July 2015 Equinox was purchased by a private buyer and relocated to the East Coast.
boat.short_description: Equinox is a 24 ft. 6" Cornish Crabber 24 built in 1999 and based in Chichester. Burgundy hull, two tone deck and tan mainsail, staysail and jib with a red and white striped topsail.
